subject: Ang: Re: [junit] DBC
msgSnippet: I can see your point from a component manufacturer s point of view - I can test that I can fullfil my contract using JUnit. From a component user view point
messageBody:
I can see your point from a component manufacturer's point of view - I can
test that I can fullfil my contract using JUnit.

From a component user view point I'd still like to see a concise
description of the prerequisites without having to dig into the component
code or even the unit testing code...
... though I realise I'm in danger of reopening the javadoc v unit test
discussion :-)





"J. B.
Rainsberger" Till: junit@yahoogroups.com
<jbr@diasparsof Kopia:
tware.com> Ärende: Re: [junit] DBC

2002-04-02
17:23
Sänd svar till
junit






>From: steven.hale@...
>
>Interesting to see that John Goodsen (private method thread) is using
>Design By Contract in conjunction with unit testing and JUnit. Is anybody
>else is doing this and how they are implementing DBC (iContract? JASS? or
>merely at a documentation level?)

Test-Driven Development drives a programmer towards DBC on a test-by-test
basis. As a result, although I don't use DBC tools, I believe I'm doing DBC

by simply writing the tests first. In a way, JUnit is my DBC tool.

J. B. Rainsberger
President, Diaspar Software Services
